hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: Until August atarax tablets The title of this literary debut receives scant explanation within the novel, so it takes some digging to find out that it refers to a Mississippi railroad crossing, long immortalised in blues songs, where the “Southern” line crosses the colloquially known “Yellow Dog” line. Within the story, a devilish dog is also the form taken by a curse, as it stalks a black itinerant called Robert Chatham throughout his misadventures. After his childhood home is destroyed by the Great Mississippi Flood of 1927, Robert’s wanderings take him across a swampy landscape teeming with rapacious land developers, rascally bluesmen, tender-hearted prostitutes, murderous Cajun fur trappers and racist white townsfolk.
